intro: Diplotaxis villosa, commonly known as the woolly goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats. Diplotaxis villosa is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
